messages.author: wtc
messages.text:
Please add this test after the false_start_enabled test
to match the declaration order of these members.

messages.author: wtc
messages.text:
It seems wrong to call this SSLConfigService "TLS1 only"
because it still enables SSL3 (see line 29).

Perhaps this class should be named TLS10SSLConfigService

messages.author: wtc
messages.text:
All instances of "SSL 3.0 fallback" in this file should be
changed to something like "Permissive SSL 3.0 fallback" or
"Unrestricted SSL 3.0 fallback" to be more accurate.

messages.author: wtc
messages.text: Typo: ssl3_verlback_enabled_ => ssl3_fallback_enabled_

messages.author: wtc
messages.text: Typo: ssl3_versionk_enabled_ => ssl3_fallback_enabled_

messages.author: wtc
wtc
messages.text:
This should fit on one line now:
  config->ssl3_fallback_enabled = ssl3_fallback_enabled_.GetValue();

messages.author: wtc
wtc
messages.text:
NOTE: I still think this member name is confusing. I think
something like "permissive_ssl3_fallback_enabled" or
"ssl3_fallback_unrestricted" would be more accurate.

messages.author: wtc
messages.text: This should fit in one line now.

messages.author: wtc
messages.text:
Delete "(version_max == SSL_PROTOCOL_VERSION_SSL3 &&" and the
corresponding closing ")".

This is implied by how C/C++ evaluates the two operands of
the || operator, and the fact that SSL_PROTOCOL_VERSION_SSL3
is the smallest SSL version used by Chrome.

messages.author: thaidn_google
messages.text:
Nice catch.

Thanks!
On 2013/04/18 18:15:34, wtc wrote:
> 
> Delete "(version_max == SSL_PROTOCOL_VERSION_SSL3 &&" and the
> corresponding closing ")".
> 
> This is implied by how C/C++ evaluates the two operands of
> the || operator, and the fact that SSL_PROTOCOL_VERSION_SSL3
> is the smallest SSL version used by Chrome.

messages.author: wtc
messages.text:
This comment should say something like
"Enables permissive SSL 3.0 fallback" or
"Enables unrestricted SSL 3.0 fallback".  We probably should
just duplicate the comment from ssl_config_service.h.

messages.author: wtc
messages.text:
Nit and optional: we should rename this method "reset_next_index"
for a consistent style. The Style Guide allows lowercase letters
for very short inlined functions.

> // Test that
> // * without command-line settings for minimum and maximum SSL versions,
> //   SSL 3.0 ~ default_version_max() are enabled;
> // * without --enable-ssl3-fallback, |ssl3_fallback_enabled| is false.

Done.

message: Fix a bug that prevents TLS 1.1 -> TLS 1.0 fallback.
